com.googlecode.csse460_2010.client
Class XMLParser

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.csse460_2010.client.XMLParser

public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object

This class takes care for parsing the XML configuration file. It also stores all the data which can be retrieved using the getters defined at the end if this class.

Author:
Christopher Rabotin

getClientMsg

public static java.lang.String getClientMsg(java.lang.String key)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Getter for a particular client message.

Parameters:
key - the key which references the wanted value
Returns:
the value of the given key
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the key is not found an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. This should only happen is the XML is not properly designed (e.g. has been changed and does not fulfill the requirements specified in the XML file).

loadNParse

public static void loadNParse(java.io.InputStream xmlF)
                       throws org.jdom.JDOMException,
                              java.io.IOException
This function loads and parse the XML file xmlF. To parse it calls the methods parseCnx(), parseCmds() and parseGameMsg().

Parameters:
xmlF - the XML file to be parsed
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException - if the XML is not properly formatted
java.io.IOException - if the XML file cannot be read

parseCmds

private static void parseCmds()
Parses the <Cmds></Cmds> elements of the XML file. Each <cmd></cmd> element should have an <args><args> element. The read data is stored in the cmds HashMap where the key is the client attribute of the element and the value is an instance of Command.

parseCnx

private static void parseCnx()
This function parses the <Cnx></Cnx> element of the XML file. If there are multiple such element (which should NOT be the case), only the first one is taken into consideration. The read data is stored into cnxHost, cnxPort and cnxTimeout respectively for the host, the port and the timeout to establish the connection.

parseGameMsg

private static void parseGameMsg()
Parses the <GameMsgs></GameMsgs> elements of the XML file. There are two types of such elements: the ClientMsg elements and the ServerMsg elements. The former are messages which will be printed to the client on the client's request (e.g. the welcome message is asked by the Client.java class on startup). The latter are translations of the server protocol. The parsed data is stored in two HashMaps: the client messages (ClientMsg) are stored in the clientMsgs Hashmap and the server messages are stored in the serverMsgs HashMap. In both cases the key corresponds to the name attribute (the for attribute for the case of serverMsg) and the value is the content String of the messages.

parseMsg

public static java.lang.String parseMsg(java.lang.String msg,
                                        java.lang.Class cls)
Parses the given String (msg) to replace all the occurrences of variables with their actual value using reflection (java.lang.reflect). The variables are words starting with a $ sign.

Parameters:
msg - the message to be parsed by the function
cls - the class (not an instance of the class) which contains the fields of the text variables
Returns:
the parsed string
